H0.text: Density is the property the engineer should concentrate on the most when designing the rocket, because the engineer was assigned to build a model rocket that must be made from a metal capable of releasing the energy built up during atmospheric reentry.

H1.text: Ductility is the property the engineer should concentrate on the most when designing a model rocket that must be built from a metal capable of releasing the energy built up during reentry into Earthâ€™s atmosphere.

H2.text: Specific heat is the property the engineer should concentrate on when designing a model rocket that must be built out of a metal capable of releasing the energy built up during reentry into Earth's atmosphere.

H3.text: Boiling point is the property the engineer should focus on when building a model rocket that must be made from a metal capable of releasing the energy built up during atmospheric reentry.

A4.text: The specific heat capacity of a substance is the amount of heat that must be added to one unit of mass of the substance in order to cause an increase of one unit in temperature.

A5.text: The specific heat capacity is not meaningful if the substance undergoes irreversible chemical changes, or if there is a phase change, such as melting or boiling, at a sharp temperature within the range of temperatures spanned by the measurement.
